newsitem.title: SWEDEN: GOLF-ROCCA HOLDS ON TO LEAD AS RAIN DISRUPTS MASTERS.
newsitem.headline: GOLF-ROCCA HOLDS ON TO LEAD AS RAIN DISRUPTS MASTERS.

text.p: Italy's Costantino Rocca discarded a rib support he has been wearing for two months and took the lead in the first round of the rain-hit Scandinavian Masters on Thursday.
Rocca, ninth in Europe's Ryder Cup table, carded a seven-under-par 65 to lead by a stroke from another Cup hopeful, Ireland's Padraig Harrington, and Spain's Jose Rivero.
Another Spaniard, Ignacio Garrido, Joakim Haeggman of Sweden and England's Mark Roe were a further stroke back.
Rocca, who had finished his round before a three-and-a-half hour suspension for lightning and torrential rain, established his lead with seven birdies and no bogeys.
The Italian suffered a rib injury two months ago. He had to pull out of the U.S. Open and slipped down the Ryder Cup table.
"I took off the bandage today and felt really free, the first time I've been able to turn and swing properly for a long time," said Rocca. "It was my best round of the year and I feel good.
"I know I have to do well out of the five events left before the (Ryder) team is selected and this is a good start."
There was gloom at the last for Jose Maria Olazabal of Spain, currently holding the 10th and last place in Europe's Ryder Cup table.
Olazabal bogeyed the last in near darkness for a 69 to be four off the lead.
Jesper Parnevik of Sweden, who could get one of Severiano Ballesteros's wild cards for Valderrama, along with Englishman Nick Faldo, if Olazabal qualifies in an automatic top-10 place, shot 70.
European Order of Merit leader Ian Woosnam of Wales crashed to a 76 while one of his main rivals, Colin Montgomerie of Scotland, who lies third in the European rankings, hit a 72.
The rain delay left several players needing to return to the course on Friday morning to complete their first rounds.
